summary: The video explains the origin story of the Brabus company, founded by Mr. Bushman. Initially, Mr. Bushman owned a Porsche 911 Turbo, which he parked in front of his parents' Mercedes shop. His father disapproved of the car, considering it inappropriate for their family's status, and insisted that Mr. Bushman sell it and purchase an S-Class Mercedes instead. Dissatisfied with the S-Class due to its lack of speed and aggression, Mr. Bushman began modifying it to meet his preferences. As others noticed his modifications, they requested similar tuning services, leading to the establishment of Brabus. The name 'Brabus' is derived from combining the first three letters of Mr. Bushman's name ('Bra') and the last three letters of his surname ('bus').
keywords: Brabus, Mr. Bushman, Porsche 911 Turbo, Mercedes S-Class, tuning, car modification, founder, brand name origin
